You sense that powerful forces are at work and you will have to fight them with something of equal measure.

It doesn't matter as the magical mace does its job and shatters the barrier utterly. You hear the sound of a million shards of glass land on the ground but see nothing, they are invisible to your eyes and impossible to touch. The route to the castle is now clear.

It makes your nose tickle and feel the irresistible urge to sneeze. Don't put anything down or it might get absorbed into the decor. In the centre of the room is a round table with three legs of different lengths leading it to tilt to one side, the crystal ball in the centre peaks out from under a dirty cloth draped over it. There is an empty chair in front of you and on the other side of the table waits an old woman, seated, hands crossed and staring into the middle distance. She hears you enter and cocks her head to one side.

arguments: Do you have a fortune for me?
"Do you have a fortune for me?" you ask Scabby Mary, sitting on the chair in front of the table.

"Ah let me see." she replies, fondling her crystal ball. "Hmm yes, ah... ok. I see. Prepare yourself young one." she pauses for a second then wipes her nose on her sleeve. "You're going to die horrrrriiblyy, probably in a very embarrassing way!", you start back with this revelation - "What, are you sure?" you stutter. "Sure about what?" says Mary. "The horrible dying, the embarrassing nature? But take heart fledgling, nothing yet happened is truly for certain.". She is quite noncommittal and you sense that is all the sense you will get out of her.

items.name: Scabby Mary

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: You put the glasses into Scabby Mary's hands, who grabs at them and furrows her brow confused and unsure what you've passed to her. "These will help you see more clearly Mary, wrap the arms around your ears and rest them on your nose.". After a moment of bemused fumbling she manages to follow your instructions and peers out through the lenses at you. She smiles - "Thank you, I can see clearly now, I've not been able to see like this for so many years.".

items.description: Scabby Mary sits before you, in front of her fortune telling table, cogitating your future. You can sense a great intensity about her but also that she is quite short sighted. items.description: This contraption provides a means by which you can breathe underwater. It has a goat's bladder sac full of air and a mouth piece carved from the horn of a gazelle. The idea is you breathe through the mouth piece, taking in the air from the bladder sac. It's very basic and has been hand stitched together, the seams look a little shoddy. It won't get you far underwater, but maybe just far enough.

locations.description: This is Frank's Tool Shed, as much an actual tool shed as it is a shop. Racks of contraptions and mechanical gizmos line the walls and clutter the floor and benches around you. Frank moons about the place, inspecting his wares, occasionally oiling a spring or unsprunging a gimlet. He looks like he knows what he's up to but you're not sure you know what he's up to.

arguments: "I'm looking for something." you say, addressing Frank.
"Ahh" nods Frank, giving you a sly wink. "Aren't we all sonny, now, now.".

items.name: Frank

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: "Oh fourteen groats is it, standard power yak zapper you after? Here you go sonny, professional use only of course, don't wanna get caught by the fuzz, now, now." says Frank as he takes the coins from you, handing you the yak zapper in exchange. "Fully charged and ready to run, if you run low on batteries I can do you a deal, just pop in any time now, now.".

items.description: The owner of Frank's tool shed stands before you, overseeing his shop, ready to answer any questions you might have and to sell you whatever you need, for a price. But before he'll do anything he'll want to see the colour of your money.

items.description: This is a commonly found contraption hereabouts used to direct yaks in the direction that their herders wish them to go.

locations.description: This is the once-eminent Bank of Ubiquity, in its day known for the shrewdness of its bankers, the stoic nature of its account holders and the thoroughness of its money cleaners. They had to be very thorough on account of most of the money passing through the bank was generated by the local yakonomy, however the bank was brought to its knees by revelations of its grimy dealings with the criminal Yakuza and their black market yak dealings. A dirty business indeed.

items.name: Guard
items.description: The guard dead eyes you, then stink eyes you for good measure. It's likely that he wants you to leave but the implication is not clear.

items.name: Bank Teller
items.description: The bank teller is fuming at the thought of money seeping from the accounts held within these walls. He's particularly angry that you are here and clearly wants you to leave.

arguments: I'd like to deposit some money

You approach the bank teller, coughing in advance to attract his attention. "I'd like to deposit some money." you state, aimlessly fiddling with your pockets with the intention of implying they actually contain some coin.
"Why of course sir, do you have an account with us?" replies the teller.
"Yes I do young fellow." you say without thinking, the man behind the counter is clearly of much more advanced age than you.
"Wonderful, I'm sorry I didn't recognise you. Can you confirm for me your name?".
Puffing yourself up you decide to try out a pseudonym you've been toying with "I am Clarence.". The teller cocks his head to one side, quizzically. "Of Davenport." you add for good measure.

The teller's eyes turn wild as soon as he hears the full name - "Clarence of Davenport, the great debtor?", he grinds his gums, chomping with anxiety. You can almost see him calculating the risk to the banks reputation in quatloos. Leaning backwards whilst keeping an eagle eye on you he tugs hard on a bell string, ringing for the bank's guard who comes rushing out of a back room. "See that this man is escorted from the premises immediately!", the last word culminating in a high pitched squeak of outrage. The guard dead eyes you and you suspect you may no longer be welcome here.
You take a deep breath, and coo in a soft lilting voice - "Barbara, Barbara Bagshaw".

"Babs, is that really you? It's been so long, you said you'd never come back to this hokey poke town. To you it was just a place where dreams were crushed and dreamers were fools. What's brought you back, my love, my dearest, my darling?". The teller clearly recognizes the name, although you strongly suspect his eye sight may be in dire need of correction. Preferring to avoid any romantic proposals you quietly step back heading for the door. "Babs? Barbara? Pooky?"... You refrain from responding further and the teller settles back to his work, as though you had never approached him.

"I'd say so!" chuckles the teller. "Don't worry we'll soon get you sorted out, we're always happy to have a new depositor join our happy banking family.". The man grins a toothless grin. "Now what did you say your name was and how many head of yak do you own?" he asks peering over his glasses expectantly.
I'd like to withdraw some money
"I'd like to withdraw some money?", a statement that started as a command and slowly, tragically became a question.

"The audacity! The outrage, sir! Why we'd have a run on the bank with talk like that. A. Run. On. The. Bank! We can't simply let people withdraw their money after putting it in now can we? You clearly have not the slightest idea how a yakonomy works.".
"Pray good sir, what do you mean?" you ask, semi-seriously hoping for a reasonable answer.

"Well if you took money out, then someone else would have to put some in wouldn't they? That means we'd have to tell someone that we needed them to put extra money in the bank. Well, if we go round telling people that the bank needs their money they'll wonder what for and poof..." the teller mimes an elaborate gesture, presumably to indicate a run on the bank has occurred - "we have a run on the bank!". He settles back in his seat, picks up his pen and continues to work, as though everything has now been satisfactorily explained.
I'd like to borrow some money
You step forward and address the teller directly "I'd like to borrow some money".
"Hahahaha". The teller chuckles through his nose before returning to his paperwork.
I'm wiggling my pinky at you
You wiggle your pinky at the teller. He squints and peers, "What are you doing?". "I'm wiggling my pinky at you." you reply. "But why?" continues the delightful conversation.
"I don't know" you state, feeling very foolish. The teller returns to work, tutting and mumbling.
"I still have one." you state with an air of glowering menace.

Suddenly the teller's mood turns sour, you sense you've struck a nerve. "Alright, I don't want any trouble. You know I paid my dues." he says to you. You pause before saying anything, hoping that he will elaborate so that you can discover exactly where this might lead. Eventually you start to reply "What are..." but before you can say any more he interrupts you - "How much do you need this time? You know you're bleeding me dry, you and your Yakuza pals." his tone is sullen but defeated. He clearly had a rough ride with these Yakuza chaps. You respond swiftly, thinking on your feet "Fourteen groats, this time.". The teller quickly counts out the money and hands it to you, mumbling and trying to focus on his papers again.

locations.description: A hairy and sweaty place, a confusing melange of farm and hairdresser. There are several seated men and women, waiting, flicking through magazines with the latest hair styles in, idly chattering away whilst their charges, their yaks, are being tended to by a tall handsome man who keeps sweeping his long blonde fringe back over his head in an exaggerated motion. He's already starting to annoy you. This is a yak parlour, which explains everything.

arguments: How much to shave my yak?
"How much to shave my yak?" you ask Larry.

"Ten guineas, but you'll need an actual yak, I will not cut a hair on your head, I will not dress it, trim it, pluck it or prune it and if you try to pass off a particularly hairy uncle I will know!" replies Larry. He doesn't look up at all, he's so concentrated on his work.
Where can I find the witch?
"Where can I find the witch?" addressing Larry, whilst simultaneously raising one eyebrow and looking meaningful.
He doesn't look up from the yak he's working on, you don't think he heard you.
With a quick leading 'Ahem' you state "Excuse me, I'm looking for the witch Bella, do you know where I can find her?".
The room goes silent, Larry pauses, looking up and turns to you. "I'm busy, can't you see all these people are waiting for their darlings to be groomed?". He turns back to his work.

items.name: Larry
items.description: Larry the yak shaver, a popular man in Ubiquity due to his flair for turning a scruffy, straggly yak mullet into a buoyant bouffant, a coiffured comb over, a perfect perm. In any other town this man's talent would have been wasted, however since the whole socio-economic structure of Ubiquity thrives on the yak trade, the yakonomy, he's able to engage in a thriving business. One of the few left hereabouts.

arguments: How much to shave my yak?
"How much to shave my yak?" you ask Larry.

"Ten guineas usually but this yak looks to be in desperate need. Plus what wonderful bone structure he has. Oh yes, I could do wonderful things with this one." Larry starts muttering to himself, you catch the occasional hair dressing term "perfect length for an A-line bob", "perhaps some gentle feathering at the ends" and some unexpected nautical ones "better give this one a wide berth", "not sure about the cut of his jib". You are slightly mesmerised and have to force yourself to snap back to reality.
So you'll cut him for free?
"So you'll cut him for free?" you ask.
"Of course, such a specimen, such an opportunity, I'd be honoured" replies Larry. The yak looks around the parlour, slowly chewing and contemplating the meaning of life.
Where can I find the witch?

"Great! Whilst you're at it I don't suppose you know where I can find the witch Bella?". The room goes quiet, there is some foot shuffling and much staring at the floor. You glance about but no one will match your gaze.

"Indeed I do. You can find her in her castle fortress a small way outside of the town." replies Larry. His voice turns to a hushed whisper, "Go through The Rickets, you'll find the gate there. You'll need a key to the gate, have mine.". He passes you a small brass key and continues "Do what you can for us, the witch queen has caused us great harm and suffering. She takes our precious yak milk, yak fur and yak bread and leaves us with little. But her spies are everywhere - be careful!".

items.description: It is slightly larger than a metric cow but smaller than an average horse. It's hairy, bad tempered and prone to biting so you stay well back. This particular yak has a very shaggy coat, you reckon it would make at least four good sized winter jackets or a single yacket. The yak notices you looking at it and snorts loudly in your direction, partly spraying you with nasal fluid. It sprays with a lot more fluid than an accidental spraying might generate, you half suspect it did it on purpose.

items.name: Brass key
items.description: It's a key made of brass, although it has faded a little from the natural wear of being in someone's pocket for many years. This is Larry the yak shavers key to The Rickets gate exit to Ubiquity.

locations.description: You stand before a mighty clock tower. The clock goes TICK! South is blocked by a barricade. There is a path amongst the rubble of several buildings to the east leading to what must be the town hall.

arguments: I see you have your basket

Oubliette nods. "There is a clearing to the north of here where we can reach the castle, follow me." she says as she walks off around the clock tower and disappears. You'd better keep up with her in case you get lost!

items.name: Oubliette
items.description: She is a slight girl with a strong boot wielding arm, of which you have had first hand experience, holding a woven basket. She is fairly tall with auburn hair that shines slightly in the fading sunlight. You find she catches you mildly off guard. You make a mental note not to make a fool of yourself in front of her.

items.name: Fire shield
items.examine_message: The shield has rolled here from outside the town hall. You push up against it, heaving to try to budge it and ever so slightly it starts to move again. You are able to get up a little momentum before having to let it go its own way, weaving through the streets heading towards the north barricade.
items.description: It is a large contraption, mostly wood and metal, held upright on a wheeled cart so that it will protect whatever is behind it from fire attacks. There are numerous pitted scorch marks on the front plate showing it has seen plenty of use. It has come to a rest, the break handle now in the engaged position with the key still in place.

locations.description: Picking your way through the remains of two ruined buildings you can see a clock tower to the west and further to the east is a large building that looks like it might be the town hall.

You are outside the town hall. The large wooden double doors in front of you are emblazoned with the town crest - two white dragons perched in a tree. It has been boarded up to protect it from the attacks, no doors or windows are visible.

items.name: Fire shield

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: You place the key in the lock and turn it. A click and the latch springs open and the chain drops away leaving the fire shield free.

There are numerous pitted scorch marks on the front plate showing it has seen plenty of use. It is currently immobile as it is chained and locked to a metal ring buried in the ground.

items.name: Fire shield
items.examine_message: Studying the workings of the shield you notice that the wheels are controlled by a basic break mechanism that looks to be disengaged by pulling a handle emerging from the mess of axles and springs.
items.description: It is a large contraption, mostly wood and metal, held upright on a wheeled cart so that it will protect whatever is behind it from fire attacks. There are numerous pitted scorch marks on the front plate showing it has seen plenty of use.

items.name: Break handle

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: You place the key in the slot at the end of the handle which becomes moveable as you do so. Lifting the handle up and guiding it slightly out of the resting position you release the breaks and the machine starts to roll. Too late you realise it is on a slight slope, enough to cause the weight of the shield to propel it, slowly at first, away from the town hall. You fumble with the key in the break handle as you trot alongside it, attempting to engage the break once again but your fingers miss their target several times and the shield rolls off into the town without you. You hear a few cries of surprise as it disappears around the bend of the road, heading towards the clock tower.

items.description: This is a metal bar which controls the breaks on the fire shield. It is currently engaged so that the machine will not move and there is a slot where a key might fit, an extra precaution against accidental use.

locations.description:
Only pieces remain of what must have been a great castle, fallen arches, crumbling walls. The brick and stone is covered in plant life and many creatures once made this place their home, however looking around you see only empty nests now and abandoned hideaways.
There is a great portcullis still standing, embedded in the brickwork of a gatehouse.

items.name: Portcullis
items.examine_message: Looking closely at the portcullis you see the metal itself is quite rusted and flakes peel off easily. The portcullis is bolted to a large mechanism in the walls of the gatehouse that would have controlled opening and closing it.
items.description: The portcullis is embedded into brick which used to form a fortified gatehouse. Now it is fairly decayed but sturdy enough that it is clear you cannot open it. Looking through you can see the castle courtyard.

items.name: Portcullis
items.description: The portcullis is embedded into brick which used to form a fortified gatehouse. It looks sturdy enough but is quite rusted. It has been wedged open with a few bricks, high enough to scramble underneath to reach the outside of the castle gate.

items.name: Jammed mechanism

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: Wielding the iron bar aloft you shove it right in the middle of the mechanism, hoping that since you have no idea what you are doing with the iron bar and the delicate mechanism that you will get lucky with a display of brute force. This also has the advantage of allowing you to show off your manliness to Oubliette, who watches from a distance, slightly further away than she already was. The iron bar predictably becomes stuck in the portcullis cogs, so in for a penny in for a pound, you push your full weight down upon the iron bar - snap, crack! You hope that wasn't your back. A quick check to confirm you've not done yourself an embarrassing injury and you return to the gate, inspecting the jam and concluding that it is now most likely unjammed.

items.description: The mechanism is rusty like the rest of the portcullis itself. You poke and nudge it but it appears to be jammed.

items.name: Unjammed mechanism
items.description: The mechanism is rusty like the rest of the portcullis itself. It was jammed but looks to be in working order now.

arguments: "We need to get into the courtyard. Can you see if you can find a way through?" asks Oubliette. "I'll wait here until it's safe to continue.".
"Sure, I'll be right back.". Always eager to be a hero you stride off to investigate the situation more closely.

items.description: She is a slight girl with a strong boot wielding arm, of which you have had first hand experience, holding a woven basket. She is fairly tall with auburn hair that shines slightly in the fading sunlight. You find she catches you mildly off guard. You make a mental note not to make a fool of yourself in front of her.

arguments: "It's safe, let's go.". You point towards the portcullis.
"It doesn't look very safe - the portcullis isn't even open. I think I'll wait here until you find a non-imaginary way in.". A disappointing response, but who can blame her.
There's no way forward, let's go back
"There's no way forward, let's go back." you say sheepishly.

Oubliette looks at you with disappointment. "If we go back now I won't have what I need for my healing balms and salves. The townsfolk are depending on me.". She doesn't look like she's going anywhere.

arguments: "It's safe, let's go.". You point towards the portcullis.
"Well done!" she exclaims and skips off to the courtyard.

locations.text_to_show_on_first_entry: Following Oubliette behind the clock tower you race to catch up to her. She is wasting no time, night is falling, the barricades must be prepared and the townsfolk must be ready for the confrontation to come. The path is overgrown with long grass, creeping thorn weeds cover the ground snatching at your feet, now and again Oubliette catches her dress and a thread is left behind. After walking for many minutes the path opens out to a clearing and you see the castle ruins laid out before you.

locations.description: This area is very overgrown, nature has really taken root. There is a crumbling pile of rocks which used to be a wall adjacent to the gatehouse and the undergrowth around you has encroached upon every man-made structure and material. Vines and thorny weeds entwine themselves around metal and rock alike, providing numerous hiding places for all manner of creatures.

exits.label: Path over some precariously positioned rocks

items.name: Undergrowth
items.examine_message: You prod around the undergrowth with the tip of your boot, clearing an area large enough to stand in the middle of. From there you examine the area in greater detail and find a rod of some sort, entangled in the morass of vegetation. Tearing away the plants covering it you unveil a large iron bar.
items.description: The undergrowth is thick and verdant, there could be all manner of things hidden within.

items.name: Iron bar
items.description: This a large iron bar, it might be good for poking things, hitting stuff or unjamming jammed things. It might even lead to something being jammed if you are not careful.

items.name: Crumbling rocks
items.examine_message: Upon closer inspection you spot a path across the rocks that should gain you access to the courtyard within the castle.
items.description: These rocks used to be part of the wall, they have handily piled themselves up into a steep slope that, with a little careful navigation, you might be able to surmount.

locations.description: Like the rest of the ruins the castle courtyard is covered in plant life, which has taken a firm foothold, dislodging a large part of the foundation of many of the walls of what remains of the castle. You imagine the rest of the site must be a dangerous place, if only for the instability of the structure surrounding you. The castle gate lies on the south side of the quadrangle, where the gatehouse envelopes a sad portcullis, guarding nothing but the decaying remains of this abandoned castle.

exits.label: Path over some precariously positioned rocks

items.description: The portcullis winch is embedded into the brickwork around the portcullis itself. It looks undamaged, if a little weather beaten. There is a hole at one end.

items.name: Winch

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: You slot the handle into the hole in the end of the device and start to turn it. Clunk. Clunk. Clunk. You breath a sigh of relief as it starts to turn, the portcullis squeaks and grinds and groans and finally begins to raise. You puff and pant with the exertion, the gate is very heavy and the winch occasionally slips. Eventually the portcullis is high enough to get under. Leaving the winch handle in place you push a few bricks underneath for extra support in case the winch fails to hold.

arguments: The portcullis winch is embedded into the brickwork around portcullis itself. It looks undamaged, if a little weather beaten. The winch handle hangs out of a hole at one end.

items.name: Winch handle
items.description: This is a dog leg winch handle, well made from strong metal it would usually have been used by two men at a time.

arguments: "Just over there, can you go and see if it's safe?" asks Oubliette as she points to the north side of the courtyard.
"Sure, I'll be right back.". With a little trepidation you look to the north of the courtyard wondering what lies ahead.

"It doesn't look very safe - you've not even looked yet.". Oubliette furrows her brow and glares as if willing you to be the brave hero she needs. How unfortunate.
I've got a bad feeling, let's go back
"I've got a bad feeling, let's go back." you say trying to hide your cowardice.

Oubliette looks at you and shakes her head. "If we go back now I won't have what I need for my healing balms and salves. The townsfolk are depending on me.". She doesn't look like she's going anywhere.

"Excellent!" she exclaims and runs off to the north part of the courtyard.

locations.text_to_show_on_first_entry: You clamber over the rocks and leap down into the courtyard below. Standing quietly you listen carefully for the sound of any scurrying animals or tweeting birds. Strangely you hear nothing which adds to your unsettled feeling that something else is here with you.

locations.description:
This is the north end of the quadrangle surrounded on all sides by rotting buildings in various states of decay. There is a tower in one corner that has been more resistant to the relentless encroachment of vegetation and from it seems to be a slide that has been purposely built or fashioned by repeated use. It is made of worn bricks and leads from the top of the tower to close by your feet.
You can see some fungi interspersed through the ruins but there is no way it can be reached with the barrelling goon rocketing about.

items.name: Barrelling Goon
items.description: It is hairy and rolled up like a ball, barrelling around the structure of ramps and slides that are all around you. You can see two pink eyes tucked away in the mass of fur and there is enough of a glint of sharp spiky teeth to make you nervous about getting too close to this creature. No one would be safe in this place with this monster careering about.

items.name: Ramps and slides

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: Placing the hollow trunk so that it connects the slide by your feet to a ramp that extends over the ruin walls you stand back and wait. Nothing occurs, the creature does not venture forth. You jump up and down shouting then suddenly you see movement at the top of the tower. A deep growling, a whoosh of air and the barrelling goon shoots out of the tower down the ramp towards your feet at a breakneck pace hurtling into the hollow section of tree trunk and out onto the connected ramp. A short squeal of surprise and the creature is launched over the castle walls, a bundle of fur flying through the air, leaving the courtyard unguarded and free for foragers to reap the mushroomy rewards within.

arguments: This is the north end of the quadrangle surrounded on all sides by rotting buildings in various states of decay. There is a tower in one corner that has been more resistant to the relentless encroachment of vegetation and from it seems to be a slide that has been purposely built or fashioned by repeated use. It is made of worn bricks and leads from the top of the tower to close by your feet. You can see some fungi interspersed through the ruins.

items.description: There are numerous ramps and slides all around you, fashioned from the ruined brick of the castle. They look to have been worn smooth through something rubbing along them. A number of the routes come to an abrupt end where the creature is fired off, some distance, to the next ramp or slide. One of the ramps leads over the castle walls but does not appear to be connected to any of the others.

items.name: Section of hollow tree trunk
items.description: This is a short piece of hollowed out tree trunk, about an arms length and as long as you are tall. It is light enough that you can just about lift it.

items.name: Mushrooms

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: You pop the plucker over the frilly mushrooms and one by one you extract them all from their nooks and crannies and put them delicately in your pocketses.

items.description: Precious wild mushrooms that have healing powers - or so you've been told by Oubliette. They are scattered around, poking out from crevices and between rocks, frilly heads on dainty stalks, almost harmless looking.

items.name: Mushrooms
items.description: Precious wild mushrooms that have healing powers - or so you've been told by Oubliette. These have been professionally gathered from the courtyard of the ruined castle. They have frilly heads on dainty stalks, almost harmless looking.

items.name: Mushroom

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: That mushroom has done all the growing that it's going to do.

items.description: A precious wild mushroom that has healing powers - or so you've been told by Oubliette. This has been professionally gathered from the courtyard of the ruined castle. It has a frilly head on a dainty stalk, almost harmless looking.

items.name: Mushroom plucker
items.description: It is a long cone which you place over a mushroom, then you squeeze the trigger on the side and it pops the mushroom right out of the ground all in one piece. The best way to maintain a fresh fungus.

arguments: "Are those the mushrooms?" you ask pointing at the rocks.
"Yes they are, would you help me gather them?". She hands you a mushroom plucker and you blush slightly as she smiles at you.

items.name: Oubliette
items.description: She is a slight girl with a strong boot wielding arm, of which you have had first hand experience, holding a woven basket. She is fairly tall with auburn hair that shines slightly in the fading sunlight. You find she catches you mildly off guard. You make a mental note not to make a fool of yourself in front of her.

arguments: "Are those the mushrooms?" you ask pointing at the rocks.
"Yes they are, just use the mushroom plucker I gave you to pick them. When you've picked them give them to me and I'll check them over.". She smiles at you, like a teacher to a struggling pupil.

items.name: Oubliette

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: You pass the mushroom plucker and the mushrooms you have gathered to Oubliette. Placing them in her woven basket she picks one out and passes it to you. "Here, have this for your trouble, I know it's not much but it might come in handy. These mushrooms will heal if eaten, but take care not to each too much as you will fall asleep and appear to others as though dead.". She turns away to leave but hesitates - "I also found this amongst the rocks" nodding towards one of the barrelling goon's slides as she passes you a charred bone. You take it cautiously, noting the spiralling runes carved into the surface. "It's weird, goons don't usually come this close to town, maybe this has something to do with it." she shrugs. "Anyway I'm heading back to town, you know the way - thanks again!" and off she goes without glancing back. You stand alone in the courtyard shuffling your shoes and decide to head back to town with her.

items.description: She is a slight girl with a strong boot wielding arm, of which you have had first hand experience, holding a woven basket. She is fairly tall with auburn hair that shines slightly in the fading sunlight. You find she catches you mildly off guard. You make a mental note not to make a fool of yourself in front of her.

items.name: Charred rune-covered bone
items.description: You're not sure if it's human or animal but the bone is quite large. One end has been burnt to a blackened stump and runes have been carved in a spiral pattern around the bone.

locations.text_to_show_on_first_entry: Argh! A flying ball of fur shoots at you as soon as you step foot into this area, knocking you down. It continues to barrel around the courtyard rolling from ramp to slide and inexplicably back to the top of the tower in the corner. You guess this is where the creature must have come from.

locations.description: You stand inside the castle walls, in the main entrance. It was once opulent, with velvet curtains two men high draping the walls but has now been corrupted by the decay and evil that has taken control of the castle. The curtains are in tatters and leaves rustle with the wind as they blow along the stone floor. Further in you can see the flicker of flames lighting the great hall up ahead.

In the centre of the room a hanging cage draws your attention. It looks like it has been put to much use. Scattered scraps of food litter the floor beneath it and you see the odd glint of white-grey bone fragments on the floor - the remains of dinner or just remains?

items.name: Hanging Cage

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: You put the key in the lock, turn it and throw the door wide open. Oubliette leaps out as fast as she can, into your waiting arms. Putting her down gently she puts her arms around your neck and gives you a passionate kiss. "You saved me." she says and holds onto you as though she will never let go. You grasp her in return, relief rushing from you as you realise your quest is over. The witch is vanquished forever and Oubliette is safe, you have kept your promise to her father and sister and to the townsfolk of Ubiquity and Perpetuity. Oubliette kisses your cheek and leaves to return to her waiting father and sister, allowing you a moment to contemplate everything you have done.

items.description: The cage is suspended from the ceiling by a metal chain. There is a small door on the side, large enough for a person to squeeze in and out. It looks very well constructed and there is not a chance that you could open it by force. The door is shut and you notice a small key hole to the side of it.

items.name: Hanging Cage
items.description: The cage is suspended from the ceiling by a metal chain. It is very well constructed and was occupied very recently by Oubliette. There is a small door on the side, large enough for a person to squeeze in and out, now hanging open with a small black key in the lock.

items.name: Small black key
items.description: It is made of an unidentifiable metal and looks like it should fit perfectly in the lock on the hanging cage door.

items.name: Wyrm's Tongue Powder
items.description: It is a small pot of potent red powder, a quick whiff of it makes you cough and splutter. When a small amount is combined with fire it can produce a startling effect.

arguments: "Is it really you?" you ask the girl, overwhelmed with relief at having found her but also aware of the imminent danger she is still in whilst trapped in the cage.

She looks up as you speak to her, grabbing the bars of her cage. "Yes, it's me." She smiles at you hopefully but clearly frightened. "Here take this, I managed to steal it when the witch kidnapped me, she's afraid of magical fire and I think that is Wyrm's Tongue Powder. It should make ordinary fire magical." She drops a small pot between the bars to you.

items.name: Oubliette
items.description: She is sitting on the floor of a metal cage suspended from the ceiling of this room. She noticed you when you entered the room and has been following your movements since. Her eyes are wet from crying and her clothes are dirty but she is very glad to see you.

arguments: "Hang in there, I'll get you out" you try to reassure Oubliette. You don't know if it's working as she still looks quite concerned.
"The witch has the key." she calls out to you as you nod determinedly.

items.name: Oubliette
items.description: She is sitting on the floor of a metal cage suspended from the ceiling of this room. She noticed you when you entered the room and has been following your movements since. Her eyes are wet from crying and her clothes are dirty but she is very glad to see you.

arguments: "Hang on Oubliette, I'm coming" you cry out, half gasping against the mental pressure of being forced to your knees but unable to give up.
Oubliette cowers in the corner of the cage, terrified by the appearance of the demon.

items.name: Oubliette
items.description: She is sitting on the floor of a metal cage suspended from the ceiling of this room. She noticed you when you entered the room and has been following your movements since. Her eyes are wet from crying and her clothes are dirty but she is very glad to see you.

arguments: "Hang on Oubliette, I'm coming" you cry out.
Oubliette cowers in the corner of the cage, terrified by the appearance of the demon. She doesn't appear to hear you at all.

items.name: Oubliette
items.description: She is sitting on the floor of a metal cage suspended from the ceiling of this room. She noticed you when you entered the room but is now staring forlornly at your crumpled corpse in the middle of the room. Her eyes are wet from crying and her clothes are dirty.

items.name: Bella's corpse

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: That's no use on a corpse. Perhaps a closer look is needed.

items.examine_message: You bend down to search the body for the key to Oubliette's cage but as you do you see movement under the robes. Stepping cautiously back the movement increases and the robes start to rise up as smoke emanates from underneath them. A shape forms behind the cloth, getting larger until it stands taller than you - then the robe slips off to reveal a creature of nightmares. The horned demon pierces your mind with its hateful gaze, focusing all of its will upon you. Under this psychic weight you fall down to your knees and hear the demon snarl, lifting one clawed foot, scraping on the floor like fingernails on a blackboard and stepping slowly towards you.
items.description: The witch has been burnt by the green flames produced from the Wyrm's Tongue Powder.

items.name: Demon Witch

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: As the demon steps forward you thrust the kris knife upwards into its belly. The monster gasps and wails as though in terrible pain, then slowly it stops. Looking up you see the knife has not pierced its flesh at all and the demon's face turns to a contorted laugh, torturous and contemptible the beast raises its clawed fist and strikes you across the face. Again the fist comes down. This time you hear a sickening crack as your spine snaps and you drift off into oblivion. The cruel fates have deemed that you must die at the hand of this abomination - how now will you save poor Oubliette?

items.description: Your mind does somersaults as you try to reason how this monster before you was once the beautiful lady that you first encountered in Oren Constantine's mansion study. Now turned to her true nature by whatever pact with hell she must have made, she stands as a monstrous demon before you, glowering down with intense rage.

items.name: Demon Witch

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: Standing behind the demon you grasp the kris knife with your fading hands, your head still barely above its waist. You thrust the knife upwards towards where you hope its heart might be and this time, the skin breaks! The flesh is pierced and the blade buries deep into the creature. It cries out and rages against you but you hold it back on the end of the knife before it flails one last time and collapses forwards on to the floor.

items.description: Your mind does somersaults as you try to reason how this monster before you was once the beautiful lady that you first encountered in Oren Constantine's mansion study. Now turned to her true nature by whatever pact with hell she must have made, she stands as a monstrous demon before you, glowering down with intense rage. Her attention is currently directed towards Oubliette whom she glares at with impassionate calculation, eyeing her as a simple ingredient in a diabolical stew. The demon appears to be unable to see or hear you but you are not sure what good that will do you.

items.name: Demon Witch corpse
items.description: This is the puffy dead corpse of the defeated witch in her demon form. In her belly is the kris knife with which you killed her. You catch a glimpse of something under the demon's body but you can't move the corpse in your present ethereal state.

items.name: Demon Witch corpse
items.examine_message: You bend down to search the body for the key to Oubliette's cage this time wary of surprises. A moment of rummaging and you uncover a small black metal key and much to your relief there is no sign of movement from this corpse.
items.description: This is the puffy dead corpse of the defeated witch in her demon form. In her belly is the kris knife with which you killed her.

items.name: Your ghost
items.description: You definitely look a shade or two paler than usual which leads you to strongly suspect you might be dead, or worse. Your skin is translucent and where you are thinest you can see right through. It is unclear if anyone else can see you or hear you. The demon is paying you no attention, turning towards Oubliette to complete whatever devilish plans it has for her. Strangely your pockets are still full of the items you gathered in life, perhaps echoes of the mortal realm from which you were so cruelly expelled.

items.name: Your ghost

can_be_used_with.successful_use_message: Of course, the mushroom that Oubliette gave you, she said it had healing powers and you've got nothing to lose. In this light it has a slight glow that you had never noticed before and as you eat it you taste the sweetest food you've ever had, all your memories of the mortal realm, happiness and heartache, wash over you as you fall to the ground. When you come to you notice your hands are no longer translucent, you touch the ground upon which you are lying, solid ground. Looking up you see Oubliette smiling at you. It worked, you are restored.

locations.text_to_show_on_first_entry:
You walk into the room and pause for a moment to take in your surroundings. Your attention is immediately drawn to the girl in a cage suspended from the ceiling in the centre of the room, it looks like Oubliette. You hear a chuckle from the shadows - "So it was you who broke my barrier." The voice sounds familiar but is very croaky. Before you realise it the witch is upon you, Bella Constantine! You recognise her face as she rushes at you from one of the platforms at the edge of the room, a great leaping glide through the air and she levitates across the space to land only a few feet away from you.
The witch mocks you. "Welcome hero. You have come for your revenge, your reckoning for this world upon me? I think you are weak. You cannot stop me. You are no hero, just flesh and bone, flawed and scared. This isn't honourable, this isn't justice despite what you may think, you are no better than I. I'll warrant there are moments, in your grave and fearsome determination when you would collapse this hate filled, miserable world in on itself if given the power. Scream at the empty, pitiless sky - it will not listen to you.". She screams herself to emphasise the point and leaps away with a dramatic flourish into the shadows.
